remarks: Scott's trick collects all sets that have a certain property and are of the smallest possible rank.  This theorem shows that the resulting collection, expressed as in Equation 9.3 of [Jech] p. 72, contains at least one representative with the property, if there is one.  In other words, the collection is empty iff no set has the property (i.e. ` A ` is empty).  (Contributed by NM, 15-Oct-2003.)
